data.title: Ljungby Climate, Weather By Month, Average Temperature (Sweden)
data.meta_description: In Munka-Ljungby, the summers are comfortable and partly cloudy and the winters are long, very cold, snowy, windy, and mostly cloudy. Over the course of the year, the temperature typically varies from 27Â°F to 71Â°F and is rarely below 12Â°F or above 81Â°F.
data.text:
Climate and Average Weather Year Round in Munka-Ljungby Sweden

In Munka-Ljungby, the summers are comfortable and partly cloudy and the winters are long, very cold, snowy, windy, and mostly cloudy. Over the course of the year, the temperature typically varies from 27Â°F to 71Â°F and is rarely below 12Â°F or above 81Â°F.

Based on the tourism score, the best time of year to visit Munka-Ljungby for warm-weather activities is from late June to late August.

Climate in Munka-Ljungby

Average Temperature in Munka-Ljungby

The warm season lasts for 3.3 months, from May 29 to September 8, with an average daily high temperature above 64Â°F. The hottest month of the year in Munka-Ljungby is July, with an average high of 70Â°F and low of 55Â°F.

The cold season lasts for 3.9 months, from November 20 to March 17, with an average daily high temperature below 43Â°F. The coldest month of the year in Munka-Ljungby is January, with an average low of 28Â°F and high of 36Â°F.

Clouds

In Munka-Ljungby, the average percentage of the sky covered by clouds experiences significant seasonal variation over the course of the year.

The clearer part of the year in Munka-Ljungby begins around April 14 and lasts for 5.9 months, ending around October 10.

The clearest month of the year in Munka-Ljungby is July, during which on average the sky is clear, mostly clear, or partly cloudy 56% of the time.

The cloudier part of the year begins around October 10 and lasts for 6.1 months, ending around April 14.

The cloudiest month of the year in Munka-Ljungby is December, during which on average the sky is overcast or mostly cloudy 71% of the time.

Precipitation

A wet day is one with at least 0.04 inches of liquid or liquid-equivalent precipitation. The chance of wet days in Munka-Ljungby varies throughout the year.

The wetter season lasts 8.1 months, from June 4 to February 7, with a greater than 28% chance of a given day being a wet day. The month with the most wet days in Munka-Ljungby is November, with an average of 10.6 days with at least 0.04 inches of precipitation.

The drier season lasts 3.9 months, from February 7 to June 4. The month with the fewest wet days in Munka-Ljungby is April, with an average of 6.3 days with at least 0.04 inches of precipitation.

Among wet days, we distinguish between those that experience rain alone, snow alone, or a mixture of the two. The month with the most days of rain alone in Munka-Ljungby is October, with an average of 10.4 days. Based on this categorization, the most common form of precipitation throughout the year is rain alone, with a peak probability of 36% on October 30.

Daily Chance of Precipitation in Munka-Ljungby

Rainfall

To show variation within the months and not just the monthly totals, we show the rainfall accumulated over a sliding 31-day period centered around each day of the year. Munka-Ljungby experiences some seasonal variation in monthly rainfall.

Rain falls throughout the year in Munka-Ljungby. The month with the most rain in Munka-Ljungby is July, with an average rainfall of 2.5 inches.

The month with the least rain in Munka-Ljungby is April, with an average rainfall of 1.3 inches.

Average Monthly Rainfall in Munka-Ljungby

Snowfall

As with rainfall, we consider the snowfall accumulated over a sliding 31-day period centered around each day of the year. Munka-Ljungby experiences some seasonal variation in monthly snowfall.

The snowy period of the year lasts for 3.9 months, from November 20 to March 16, with a sliding 31-day snowfall of at least 1.0 inches. The month with the most snow in Munka-Ljungby is February, with an average snowfall of 2.4 inches.

The snowless period of the year lasts for 8.1 months, from March 16 to November 20. The least snow falls around July 23, with an average total accumulation of 0.0 inches.

Sun

The length of the day in Munka-Ljungby varies extremely over the course of the year. In 2024, the shortest day is December 21, with 6 hours, 53 minutes of daylight; the longest day is June 20, with 17 hours, 41 minutes of daylight.

Hours of Daylight and Twilight in Munka-Ljungby

The earliest sunrise is at 4:19 AM on June 17, and the latest sunrise is 4 hours, 22 minutes later at 8:41 AM on December 28. The earliest sunset is at 3:31 PM on December 14, and the latest sunset is 6 hours, 30 minutes later at 10:00 PM on June 23.

Daylight saving time (DST) is observed in Munka-Ljungby during 2024, starting in the spring on March 31, lasting 6.9 months, and ending in the fall on October 27.

Moon

The figure below presents a compact representation of key lunar data for 2024. The horizontal axis is the day, the vertical axis is the hour of the day, and the colored areas indicate when the moon is above the horizon. The vertical gray bars (new Moons) and blue bars (full Moons) indicate key Moon phases.

Humidity

We base the humidity comfort level on the dew point, as it determines whether perspiration will evaporate from the skin, thereby cooling the body. Lower dew points feel drier and higher dew points feel more humid. Unlike temperature, which typically varies significantly between night and day, dew point tends to change more slowly, so while the temperature may drop at night, a muggy day is typically followed by a muggy night.

The perceived humidity level in Munka-Ljungby, as measured by the percentage of time in which the humidity comfort level is muggy, oppressive, or miserable, does not vary significantly over the course of the year, staying within 1% of 1% throughout.

Humidity Comfort Levels in Munka-Ljungby

Wind

This section discusses the wide-area hourly average wind vector (speed and direction) at 10 meters above the ground. The wind experienced at any given location is highly dependent on local topography and other factors, and instantaneous wind speed and direction vary more widely than hourly averages.

The average hourly wind speed in Munka-Ljungby experiences significant seasonal variation over the course of the year.

The windier part of the year lasts for 6.3 months, from September 21 to March 29, with average wind speeds of more than 11.5 miles per hour. The windiest month of the year in Munka-Ljungby is January, with an average hourly wind speed of 13.3 miles per hour.

The calmer time of year lasts for 5.7 months, from March 29 to September 21. The calmest month of the year in Munka-Ljungby is July, with an average hourly wind speed of 9.8 miles per hour.

Average Wind Speed in Munka-Ljungby

Average Wind Speed in Munka-LjungbywindywindyJanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDec0 mph0 mph2 mph2 mph4 mph4 mph6 mph6 mph8 mph8 mph10 mph10 mph12 mph12 mph14 mph14 mph16 mph16 mph18 mph18 mph20 mph20 mph22 mph22 mphJan 2413.5 mphJan 2413.5 mphAug 39.6 mphAug 39.6 mphSep 2111.5 mphSep 2111.5 mphMar 2911.5 mphMar 2911.5 mphNowNow

The predominant average hourly wind direction in Munka-Ljungby varies throughout the year.

The wind is most often from the south for 4.1 weeks, from October 27 to November 25, with a peak percentage of 34% on November 8. The wind is most often from the west for 11 months, from November 25 to October 27, with a peak percentage of 38% on January 1.

Water Temperature

Munka-Ljungby is located near a large body of water (e.g., ocean, sea, or large lake). This section reports on the wide-area average surface temperature of that water.

The average water temperature experiences significant seasonal variation over the course of the year.

The time of year with warmer water lasts for 3.1 months, from June 15 to September 17, with an average temperature above 59Â°F. The month of the year in Munka-Ljungby with the warmest water is August, with an average temperature of 64Â°F.

The time of year with cooler water lasts for 4.0 months, from December 9 to April 10, with an average temperature below 41Â°F. The month of the year in Munka-Ljungby with the coolest water is February, with an average temperature of 35Â°F.

WaterJanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDec Temperature 37Â°F35Â°F37Â°F42Â°F51Â°F59Â°F63Â°F64Â°F59Â°F52Â°F46Â°F40Â°F

Best Time of Year to Visit

To characterize how pleasant the weather is in Munka-Ljungby throughout the year, we compute two travel scores.

The tourism score favors clear, rainless days with perceived temperatures between 65Â°F and 80Â°F. Based on this score, the best time of year to visit Munka-Ljungby for general outdoor tourist activities is from late June to late August, with a peak score in the third week of July.

Tourism Score in Munka-Ljungby

Tourism Score in Munka-Ljungbybest timeJanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDec002244668810106.66.60.00.0NowNowtemperaturetemperaturecloudscloudsprecipitationprecipitationtourism score

The beach/pool score favors clear, rainless days with perceived temperatures between 75Â°F and 90Â°F. Based on this score, the best time of year to visit Munka-Ljungby for hot-weather activities is from mid July to mid August, with a peak score in the last week of July.

Beach/Pool Score in Munka-Ljungby

Beach/Pool Score in Munka-LjungbyJanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDec002244668810102.82.80.00.0NowNowtemperaturetemperaturecloudscloudsprecipitationprecipitation

Methodology

For each hour between 8:00 AM and 9:00 PM of each day in the analysis period (1980 to 2016), independent scores are computed for perceived temperature, cloud cover, and total precipitation. Those scores are combined into a single hourly composite score, which is then aggregated into days, averaged over all the years in the analysis period, and smoothed.

Our cloud cover score is 10 for fully clear skies, falling linearly to 9 for mostly clear skies, and to 1 for fully overcast skies.

Our precipitation score, which is based on the three-hour precipitation centered on the hour in question, is 10 for no precipitation, falling linearly to 9 for trace precipitation, and to 0 for 0.04 inches of precipitation or more.

Our tourism temperature score is 0 for perceived temperatures below 50Â°F, rising linearly to 9 for 65Â°F, to 10 for 75Â°F, falling linearly to 9 for 80Â°F, and to 1 for 90Â°F or hotter.

Our beach/pool temperature score is 0 for perceived temperatures below 65Â°F, rising linearly to 9 for 75Â°F, to 10 for 82Â°F, falling linearly to 9 for 90Â°F, and to 1 for 100Â°F or hotter.

Growing Season

Definitions of the growing season vary throughout the world, but for the purposes of this report, we define it as the longest continuous period of non-freezing temperatures (≥ 32Â°F) in the year (the calendar year in the Northern Hemisphere, or from July 1 until June 30 in the Southern Hemisphere).

The growing season in Munka-Ljungby typically lasts for 5.9 months (179 days), from around April 25 to around October 21, rarely starting before April 8 or after May 12, and rarely ending before September 30 or after November 21.

Time Spent in Various Temperature Bands and the Growing Season in Munka-Ljungby

Time Spent in Various Temperature Bands and the Growing Season in Munka-Ljungbygrowing seasonJanFebMarAprMayJunJulAugSepOctNovDec0%100%10%90%20%80%30%70%40%60%50%50%60%40%70%30%80%20%90%10%100%0%Apr 2550%Apr 2550%Oct 2150%Oct 2150%May 1290%May 1290%Sep 3090%Sep 3090%Apr 810%Apr 810%Nov 2110%Nov 2110%0%Feb 120%Feb 12Jul 18100%Jul 18100%NowNowfreezingvery coldcoldcoolcomfortablefrigidwarm

frigid 15Â°F freezing 32Â°F very cold 45Â°F cold 55Â°F cool 65Â°F comfortable 75Â°F warm 85Â°F hot 95Â°F sweltering

Growing degree days are a measure of yearly heat accumulation used to predict plant and animal development, and defined as the integral of warmth above a base temperature, discarding any excess above a maximum temperature. In this report, we use a base of 50Â°F and a cap of 86Â°F.

Based on growing degree days alone, the first spring blooms in Munka-Ljungby should appear around May 11, only rarely appearing before April 28 or after May 25.

Growing Degree Days in Munka-Ljungby

Solar Energy

This section discusses the total daily incident shortwave solar energy reaching the surface of the ground over a wide area, taking full account of seasonal variations in the length of the day, the elevation of the Sun above the horizon, and absorption by clouds and other atmospheric constituents. Shortwave radiation includes visible light and ultraviolet radiation.

The average daily incident shortwave solar energy experiences extreme seasonal variation over the course of the year.

The brighter period of the year lasts for 3.3 months, from May 2 to August 11, with an average daily incident shortwave energy per square meter above 5.1 kWh. The brightest month of the year in Munka-Ljungby is June, with an average of 6.3 kWh.

The darker period of the year lasts for 4.2 months, from October 18 to February 24, with an average daily incident shortwave energy per square meter below 1.5 kWh. The darkest month of the year in Munka-Ljungby is December, with an average of 0.3 kWh.

Average Daily Incident Shortwave Solar Energy in Munka-Ljungby

Topography

For the purposes of this report, the geographical coordinates of Munka-Ljungby are 56.250 deg latitude, 12.967 deg longitude, and 75 ft elevation.

The topography within 2 miles of Munka-Ljungby contains only modest variations in elevation, with a maximum elevation change of 213 feet and an average elevation above sea level of 96 feet. Within 10 miles contains only modest variations in elevation (797 feet). Within 50 miles contains significant variations in elevation (945 feet).

The area within 2 miles of Munka-Ljungby is covered by cropland (83%) and trees (12%), within 10 miles by cropland (44%) and trees (37%), and within 50 miles by trees (33%) and water (33%).

Data Sources

This report illustrates the typical weather in Munka-Ljungby, based on a statistical analysis of historical hourly weather reports and model reconstructions from January 1, 1980 to December 31, 2016.

Temperature and Dew Point

There are 2 weather stations near enough to contribute to our estimation of the temperature and dew point in Munka-Ljungby.

For each station, the records are corrected for the elevation difference between that station and Munka-Ljungby according to the International Standard Atmosphere , and by the relative change present in the MERRA-2 satellite-era reanalysis between the two locations.

The estimated value at Munka-Ljungby is computed as the weighted average of the individual contributions from each station, with weights proportional to the inverse of the distance between Munka-Ljungby and a given station.

The stations contributing to this reconstruction are:

Ãngelholm-Helsingborg Airport (ESDB, 81%, 6 mi, northwest, 79 ft elevation change)

Ljungbyhed (ESTL, 19%, 15 mi, southeast, 62 ft elevation change)

ESDB, 81%6 mi, 79 ftESTL, 19%15 mi, 62 ft© OpenStreetMap contributors

To get a sense of how much these sources agree with each other, you can view a comparison of Munka-Ljungby and the stations that contribute to our estimates of its temperature history and climate. Please note that each source's contribution is adjusted for elevation and the relative change present in the MERRA-2 data.

Other Data

All data relating to the Sun's position (e.g., sunrise and sunset) are computed using astronomical formulas from the book, Astronomical Algorithms 2nd Edition , by Jean Meeus.

All other weather data, including cloud cover, precipitation, wind speed and direction, and solar flux, come from NASA's MERRA-2 Modern-Era Retrospective Analysis . This reanalysis combines a variety of wide-area measurements in a state-of-the-art global meteorological model to reconstruct the hourly history of weather throughout the world on a 50-kilometer grid.

Land Use data comes from the Global Land Cover SHARE database , published by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.

Elevation data comes from the Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) , published by NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

Names, locations, and time zones of places and some airports come from the GeoNames Geographical Database .

Time zones for airports and weather stations are provided by AskGeo.com .

Maps are © OpenStreetMap contributors.

Disclaimer

The information on this site is provided as is, without any assurances as to its accuracy or suitability for any purpose. Weather data is prone to errors, outages, and other defects. We assume no responsibility for any decisions made on the basis of the content presented on this site.

We draw particular cautious attention to our reliance on the MERRA-2 model-based reconstructions for a number of important data series. While having the tremendous advantages of temporal and spatial completeness, these reconstructions: (1) are based on computer models that may have model-based errors, (2) are coarsely sampled on a 50 km grid and are therefore unable to reconstruct the local variations of many microclimates, and (3) have particular difficulty with the weather in some coastal areas, especially small islands.

We further caution that our travel scores are only as good as the data that underpin them, that weather conditions at any given location and time are unpredictable and variable, and that the definition of the scores reflects a particular set of preferences that may not agree with those of any particular reader.
